title: Plastic ingestion by fish a growing problem | Stanford News
body: February 9, 2021 Stanford analysis shows plastic ingestion by marine fish is a widespread and growing problem Stanford ecologists have conducted one of the most detailed and comprehensive analyses of plastic ingestion by marine fish and shown that the rate of consumption is increasing.
readable_content: - Is there a specific section or detail in this article that you would like to discuss?
summary:
The article discusses the movement to ban plastic straws and the impact of such a ban on the environment. It highlights the negative effects of plastic pollution on marine life and the benefits of using alternative, more sustainable options. The tone of the article is supportive of banning plastic straws and emphasizes the urgent need for action to reduce plastic waste. 

Sentiment: 0.8
